"Navigation panel" widget
The "Navigation pane" widget
is a tool for navigation in the System.
Placing the widget on the
start page
will allow the user to quickly navigate to the selected menu item, registry, or object.
Example of a customized widget:
The System has 7 navigation panel templates:
A preview of the template is available by hovering over the
icon next to the template name. Available template options:
Setup
The widget is added to the object profile in
instance visual settings
mode. Drag-and-drop the required widget template from the "Navigation Panel" section of the "Widgets" tab in the "Elements" panel to the workspace.
Settings
To set up the widget, click the "Settings" button, which opens a modal window with the following settings:
Setting
Purpose
Panel editing
Panel size
Determining the panel size. Possible options:
XS;
S;
M;
L.
By default, all templates are set to XS.
Mobile app panel size
Determining the panel size in the mobile app. Possible options:
XS;
S;
M;
L.
By default, each template has its own value.
Auto width
Indicating that the width of the panel will be automatically adjusted to the available area.
The setting is inactive by default.
Rounding corners
Determining the size of the rounded corners of the panel. Possible options:
No rounding;
XS;
S;
M;
L.
By default, each template has its own value.
Shadow
Determining the shadow size. Possible options:
No shadow;
S;
M;
L.
Panel style
Determining the style of the panel background. Possible options:
Static;
Algorithm.
By default, all templates are set to "Static".
Fill
Determining the fill of the background. Possible options:
No fill;
Color;
When selecting this option, a color picker is available with the ability to select a color on the palette or enter a color code in RGBA and HEX formats.
Gradient.
The gradient is selected in the modal window.
Linear or radial gradient types can be selected. For the radial gradient, the angle of inclination in degrees can be specified.
After that, at least two gradient points should be selected by clicking the
button and the position, color and transparency for each one is specified.
This setting is available with the "Static" panel style.
Border
Determining the panel border. Possible options:
Yes;
When selecting the option, a color picker is available with the ability to select a color on the palette or enter a color code in RGBA and HEX formats.
No.
The setting is available with the "Static" panel style._
Algorithm
Selecting the algorithm that will be used to set the panel background style. +The
algorithm should return an instance of the
"Basic formatting style"
object type.
The setting is available when the panel background style is determined using an algorithm.
By clicking the button, a context menu will be displayed to select the way an image for the panel background is uploaded:
Files from disk – the file explorer opens to upload the file from the user’s device.
When adding an image from the disk, a new instance of the "File" type [FS_FILE] is created in the System.
Files from system – opens the "File" registry type [FS_FILE] to select the image previously uploaded to the System.
Acceptable file formats: *.png, *.jpg, *.jpeg.
Panel contents
Action processing
Determining the component that opens when clicking on the panel. Possible options:
Menu item;
Object;
Registry.
Menu item
Determining the menu item that opens when clicking on the panel.
The menu item is selected from the drop-down list. if necessary, the
new menu item
is configured through the parameter action menu.
The setting is available when selecting the "Menu item" action.
Object type
Determining the object type, object profile or registry that open when clicking on the panel.
The object type is selected from the drop-down list. If necessary, the
new object type is created
through the parameter actions menu.
The setting is available when selecting the "Object" or "Registry" action.
Object
The instance whose visual will be displayed when clicking on the panel.
The object is selected from the drop-down list of instances of the specified object type. If necessary,
create a new object
through the parameter actions menu.
The parameter is available when selecting the "Object" action.
Visual
Determining the object visual will be displayed when clicking on the panel.
The object visual is selected from the drop-down list of visuals of the specified object type. If necessary,
create a new object visual
through the parameter action menu.
The setting is available when selecting the "Object" action.
Registry
Determining the registry that will be displayed when clicking on the panel.
The registry is selected from the drop-down list of registries of the specified object type. If necessary,
create a new registry
via the parameter actions menu.
The parameter is available when selecting the Registry action.
Header
Entering the text of the panel header (the maximum size is 2000 characters).
Style
Determining the header style. Possible options:
Style;
Algorithm.
By default, all templates are set to "Style".
Header style
Defining the header text style. The selection is made using a drop-down list of instances of the
"Basic formatting style"
object type.
The setting is available when the "Style" options selected .
Algorithm
Selecting the algorithm that will be used to set the header text style. +The
algorithm should return an instance of the xref :formatting-style-object-type.adoc["Basic formatting style"] object type.
The setting is available when selecting the "Algorithm" option for the header style.
Description
Entering the panel description text (the maximum size is 2000 characters).
This setting is available only for templates with a description.
Style
Determining the style for the description text. Possible options:
Style;
Algorithm.
This setting is only available for templates with a description.
Description style
Defining the style for the description text. The selection is made using a drop-down list of instances of the
"Basic formatting style"
object type.
The setting is available when selecting "Style"  as the description style.
Algorithm
Selecting the algorithm that will be used to set the style for the description text.
The algorithm should return an instance of the
"Basic formatting style"
object type.
The setting is available when selecting the "Algorithm" option as a way to set the description style.
Rounding corners
Determining the size of the rounded corners of the panel. Possible options:
No rounding;
XS;
S;
M;
L.
This setting is available for templates with an additional image.
Border
Determining the panel border. Possible options:
Yes;
When selected, a color picker is available with the ability to select a color on the palette or enter a color code in RGBA and HEX formats.
No.
The setting is available for templates with an additional image._
By clicking the button, a context menu will be displayed to select the way an image for the panel background is uploaded:
Files from disk – the file explorer opens to upload the file from the user’s device.
When adding an image from the disk, a new instance of the "File" type [FS_FILE] is created in the System.
Files from system – opens the "File" registry type [FS_FILE] to select the image previously uploaded to the System.
Acceptable file formats: *.png, *.jpg, *.jpeg.
The setting is available for templates with an additional image.
The widget layout is displayed under the settings.
In the upper part of the modal window, there is the "Switch to developer mode" button, which will switch to the
widget development environment
for creating a custom widget.

Enter the page name in the window that opens, then proceed to setting up the visual by clicking the

Then, in
visual editing mode

Next, fill in the
settings
for each widget panel.
